Reviews.Title: “great location but don't come here for the swimmingpool”
Reviews.Author: bianca72
Reviews.Content: If there is an option ask for a room in the new building. We were in the old one where there is heavy renovation going on (and that does come with a lot of noise). room itself is small but fine. Swimmingpool pics are very deceiving. It is in fact very small and when we were there very crowded with just a few sunbeds, so you had to lay on the ground. They rent it out for parties so it was closed on friday and saterday at 18.00 which would have been a perfect time to visit it after a long hot day in madrid. So if you can avoid the weekend. The parties are very loud and go on until about 4 in the morning. In the old building you can here that very well. Location is very good, easy acces with metro from airport and you're right in the centre of Madrid. Gran via is about 2 minutes walk and the royal palace about 5. Breakfast is very expensive 16 euros. That's more than most of the daily specials (about 9-11 euros)! There are more hotels in the area that don't have parties at night so you'll sleep better. And I suppose a good swimmingpool is available in madrid but that would be in a different price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inge_Steffen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, very friendly reception, and in English! Room was very nice, not too big, but clean and they had everything needed. Pool is rather small, with too many people, so we didn't use it. Location is really perfect, right at the metro Santo Domingo, and very central in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very noise room !!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although in a very good location, claen room and with good rate, I wouldn't stay there again. It was very hard to sleep due to other guests noise. It seems the walls there are made of paper (you can here everything - and guests there were not very polite, slaming the door all the time, letting the radio alarm on and on forerever, etc) ... Also, as a negative point, u have to check in at on side of the building but you have to go around it to take elevators to your room. Its not so distant but there is a stairway in between and NO ONE helps with your luggage (I had 2 heavy pieces).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but at top location”
Reviews.Author: BARTVDB100
Reviews.Content: Average hotel but the location is excellent to visit the city. Before you unload your suitcases it's safer to check first if everything works : airco, shower, ... Breakfast is average. Nice swimmingpool on the top of the building but it opens only at 11.00 AM and closes at 19.30 PM. A lot of restaurants in the neighborhood and shopping possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located just off Grand Via and next to the metro. Reception was efficient although a bit cool - maybe typical of Madrid. There was some maintainance work being done in the hotel but it did not interfere much and there was little noise. The room was dissappointingly small and with no window to outside. Comfortable enough but not what I expected. Breakfast was OK but there were not enough seats/tables - go for a coffee and you could lose your table.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sumi_79_NPH
Reviews.Content: The location is just about perfect, 5 -10 min walking distance to most of the major attractions in Madrid with a Meyro station across the street. The breakfast buffet is ok. The only down side is the room, extremely small(less then 3 ft between the bed and the walls). The bathroom had a leaky shower door and a strange smell. For over 100€ a night it seemed a little pricey. In the end I would recomend this hotel for it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved hotel”
Reviews.Author: isregan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Santo Domingo for a city break with friends. Must admit that I was quite apprehensive before arrival as I had read some of the not so complementary reviews by previous guests. I have no complaints about the room and the facilities at this hotel. Our twin room was beautifully decorated and very comfortabel, and the en suite was themed and lovely. The pool on the rooftop was such a fabulous extra in the centre of Madrid, with views right out to the sierra, truly lovely and very clean. My only observation would be about some of the hotel staff, the male staff member who met us was very friendly and polite as was the one handling our luggage, however desk staff on subsequent days were not quite as approachable and several times I felt like I was distracting them from more important matters, not great when you are a paying guest. Other than that I would recommend the Santo Domingo to anyone wishing to visit Madrid, I have visited the city on many occasions and had thought that previous 4* accommodation would be hard to beat, but I will ceratinly return to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 days at Mercure Santo Domingo Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Petergiddings
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 5 days at this hotel and we would recommend it as a great base to see this beautiful city. The heat in July is unrelenting and during the days the temperature was between 35 and 40 degrees celcius.The rooftop pool at this hotel is the ideal place to cool down after a day sightseeing and although small and fairly crowded, especially over the weekend, the lifeguard/pool attendant and the 2 bar staff were very friendly and always helpful and attentive. The breakfast I thought was outstanding with a wide range of hot and cold things to choose from including fried and scrambled eggs sausage right through to croissants fresh fruit and plenty of continental style cold meats cheeses and even cakes and puddings.The freshly squeeezed orange juice was absolutely brilliant and the best I have tasted in a hotel. All in all this hotel ,which is right across the road from Santo Domingo metro on line 2 ,represents great value for money and my only small gripe was that at around 3 am every morning the bin men are very noisy when they collect the rubbish from outside the hotel but maybe this just reflects the position of our room on the first floor and would not be such an issue if you were higher up. I would definitely stay here again and do not usually write reviews but felt we were so well looked after here that this should not go unrecorded

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in hot Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Cammi9
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great- location, room, top pool / sunbeds and service. After changing room twice we ended up w a nice room with a clean big bathroom. Hotel is also within walking distance to great areas for bars, food, shopping. We didn't eat any meals here but the cocktails on the roof were top.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very small room, smelt of cigarette. Great shower. Good location, though didn't realise we were staying during mardi gras!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location - BUT”
Reviews.Author: SnowyPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a short break whilst visiting our daughter. The hotel is centrally located which probably was the only bonus about it. We were allocated a room on the street side and were lucky if I managed 3-4 hours sleep each night due to the level of noise from outside. When asked about moving room the hotel wanted to charge us to upgrade and a vastly over the odds sum of euros for the pleasure. The pool on the roof, whilst great, doesn't have a lot of lot of room surrounding it so unless you are up there all day the likelihood of you being able to find a spot nil as everyone tends to head there around teatime . We found the staff to be a bit mixed during our stay, some extremely pleasant, others a bit indifferent but certainly wouldn't rate this as a four star hotel!. Saying that - we loved Madrid - even though the demonstrations were in full force due to the austerity measures and we will certainly be coming back - but not to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Stevestorey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located close to a metro station and lots of other attractions in the city centre. Although we had booked a superior room, when we arrived we were allocated a standard room. However, this was quickly compensated for with the offer of complementary breakfasts for both of us for all 4 nights. The hotel has a roof top pool, and bar. Sunbeds are limited, as is space in general, but despite this we always found space to lay down a towel beside the pool and bask in the sunshine without feeling crowded. No problems with room. Wifi was free though signal was weak.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Snickers64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend. Pros: -location is excellent off the Gran Via. -good value; we booked through a hotel website and got a good rate including breakfast. -which was very good, especially by Spanish standards. -rooftop swimming pool great, especially for central Madrid. -rooms recently refurbished and in fairly good shape (see below). -staff, including manager, guest-focussed. Cons: -first room was very small, looked out over the dark internal courtyard, had broken/not working bits,and opposite a noisy maid's station which woke us very early and continued to be noisy. we asked to move and were moved to a much nicer room with an external view, everything working, and slightly bigger. -however, this room suffered from being under scaffolding, and for which building works started at 9 am or earlier, and for which was exceptionally noisy from then on, again disrupting sleep. -food and drinks very expensive at the pool (EUR 15 for a hamburger, EUR 12 for a cocktail) To their credit the hotel manager apologised, and as we were departing that day, gave us a late check out and offered to take the aforementioned food/drink off the bill, although ultimately only the burger was not charged. If was rating the second room, without the building works, for the price this would be a 4 or 5 rating. As the rooms vary, ask to change if you are not happy with what is offered, and do not take a room by the works unless you get up early or don't mind being roused by shouting workers and clanging!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: geraint t
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and helpfully staff. It is well placed for visiting Madrid. Most place of interest are only 10 mins walk away. The pool on the roof makes it an idea break for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dermot15
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in this hotel in July 2012. We arrived at 2300hrs and the room they gave us had electrical wires hanging out of the wall. I pointed this out and immediately our room was changed to a better room. This hotel is in a great position and very little traffic noise. Approx 200m from the Gran Via and directly opposite a metro station. (Metro to the Airport cost €8.00 each) Don’t stay on the Gran Via as the traffic is very noisy and going 24hrs. Breakfast is substantial. The pool on the roof is essential in July’s hot weather. I would stay again and recommend this hotel to friends and family. Negative side. The pool only had an area of shade for 6 sun beds. Plenty of space to relax in the sun but in that weather you need some shade. It would not cost the hotel much to supply a few parasols.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in very good location to restaurants and cafes. Would definitely stay here again and all staff very friendly. Great bar at the pool and the pool is very good also.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: OutofAfrica660213
Reviews.Content: Within max. 10 min walking time you find a lot of great places in Madrid including the great barrio La Latina or Gran Via and the palacio Real. Hotel is small, never a problem waiting too long for elevators. Rooms are small but with huge windows and no carpets but nice wooden floor. Bath room is perfect and i guess prices are fine. I was invited... Hotel bar small but everybody very friendly . Hotel is good for short business stays as well as for visiting Madrid as a tourist..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Wei_LWX
Reviews.Content: The metro station Santo Domingo is literally 5 metres away from the hotel entrance, but with tourist attraction such as the Palacio Real , Plaza Mayor and Gran Via all within 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel, there is hardly a need to take the metro. Prices are reasonable but the room i stayed in is pretty small. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Experience, will NOT RECOMMEND to any travellers!”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: Accor Group, Please retrieve all internal information correctly before replying in future. With the switch to a neighboring hotel for us paid at the expense of its own is INCORRECT .... We have PAID IN FULL via booking through Hotel.com. Due to the complication of refunding as per agreed with your Sub-director Richard Bataller we reached a compromise for the neigbouring hotel to be paid by him instead of the refunding process. We made it easier for both parties. We have travelled widely and will not make unnecessary complaints and FYI the second room with the smell of sewerage filtering through the air conditioning was acknowledged by an internal staff when he visited the room. The third room had no WiFi reception, isn't that what guest have paid for also? How it that multiple requests? Do you exactly know the full information when you reply Accor Group? How is this a World Wide standard your maintaining when you have not even contacted any of us to discuss the matter further? You already know where we are staying. There is ZERO standard in customer service here! How do you answer to your Insane GM raising his clenched fist at me in the public lobby? How about the insanity of your GM going as far as telling me to Shut Up, Get out of the hotel? How about callings the Cops he intimidated us with? What offends have we committed? Please answer all the above Accor Group! What a horrid experience we have endured and you have the audacity to respond in such manner. You have displayed a complete denial of the situation. It is such disappointment to know. There has been no apology to me for what your crazy and out of control GM reacted on the day! Ludicrous! Horrid hotel experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kylie3204
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a week on business and holiday and found the staff to be super helpful, the hotel facilities amazing and overall it was a very comfortable and pleasant stay. Would definitely recommend to any travellers to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: ZFL069
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for a great city break. Its central location is perfect to walk to all attractions, restaurants, bars and clubs, yet it is quiet and not disadvantaged by its city location. It is clean, well appointed with all the requirements for a comfortable stay. The bedroom was spacious, clean and a wonderfully equiped bathroom. The breakfast is fabulous, with a huge selection of hot, cold and fresh products, you simply can't go wrong, it's a great start for your city exploration. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay at the Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Linzey123
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel and once again had a wonderful stay. The location is perfect for anyone that wants to see the sites and be close to the bars restaurants and shops. The staff are incredibly friendly and go out of their way to assist you with any queries. The hotel is extremely clean and the rooms are stunning. We stayed in the new part of the hotel this time and had a massive balcony overlooking the city. The rooftop pool is beautiful albeit cold but that's probably just because it is so hot outside! I would highly recommend this hotel and am already planning my next trip to Madrid and will certainly be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are willing to complain a bit”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTrotter77
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! 30 yards from Gran Via, in front of a subway, 5 min walk to Royal Palace, 10 min to Puerta Del Sol. Super easy to get to. Take Aeroporto Express bus (5 euro) to Plaza Cibelles then get on metro line 2 (Banco Espana station) to Santo Domingo station. The whole ride in about 20 mins. Now the hotel: they have two wings old and new. Of course, all tourists get the old first. It's not bad, but the rooms are tiny and are 3 stars, not 4. The room missed basic things like a normal, handheld hair dryer (had that awful hose instead). No lotion, no hair conditioner, no qtips, but 2 shower caps were included! Do whatever you can: stomp your feet, threaten bad review and you'll get upgraded. The new rooms are truly 4 stars with new everything. Rooftop pool is always full and it's rather small and VERY cold. Don't eat breakfast there. Walk to Gran Via and you will see plenty of food options. Cafe & Te is okay. There are 3 Starbucks in the vicinity. For truly great culinary experience go to Mercado San Miguel!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading!”
Reviews.Author: BernVala
Reviews.Content: The photos we saw of this hotel were entirely misleading. The hotel rooms are in dire need of refurbishment. It was like being thrown back to the 70s in a room that hadn't been updated since. Breakfast was poor, but expensive. Hard to believe this hotel calls itself a 4-star. More like an average 2-star. Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, modern room”
Reviews.Author: Bruno-DF
Reviews.Content: I only got to this location after having to change hotels from Mercure Plaza de España, as they did not have any hardwood floored rooms to place us (my wife is quite allergic to carpets). The hotel is centrally located, very near the Gran Via and all those pedestrians only streets (Calle Preciados, Calle Carmen, Plaza del Sol). The room is of decent size and the bathroom's very modern and elegant. The shower was great and the back waterjet stream did the body good after a long day's walk around Madrid. Breakfast buffet was pretty sorted and the selection was of good quality. The one thing I missed was the unavailability of eating banana (I guess they'd ran out that very specific day/time). The front desk personel were very polite and efficient when it came to giving out information. It was definetely a good surprise to find thisnhotel and I'll definetely come back next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and good localization !”
Reviews.Author: Sebastiao478
Reviews.Content: The Santo Domingo Mercure Madrid is an excellent hotel. Located a few steps from Gran Via and a 200 meters from Callao Station. The room is a little bit small but it's cozy! The bathroom is good and the shower is powerfull.The hotel has a historical wine cellar (cave).It is close to the theaters and the subway allows the access to the museums (Reina Sofia 25 April-27 August with James Coleman works!) and restaurants. Madrid is an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HelenMarkhamLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 2012. I had read several bad reports before my trip which worried me however I must say that I found it to be a very pleasant stay. First of all the hotel is situated in an excellent location directly opposite Santa Domingo metro station and just off Gran Via. Some reports mentioned the renovation works in the hotel. I didn't notice any of this but I was staying in the renovated part. The hotel room was very clean, the bedding was lovely and crisp and fresh I had clean towels every day. Some people had reported that the walls are paper thin and you could hear the person in the next room. I can honestly say I never heard anything. The breakfast was excellent. Plenty of choices, cereal, fruit, eggs etc. even champagne if you wanted it. The hotel offers a shuttle service to the airport which I would recommend it only cost 13 Euros. I would definitely stay at this hotel again should I re-visit Madrid and would recommend it. The only compliant or comment I can make is that the hotel should provide tea and coffee making facilities in the room. After a long day sight seeing this would have made all the difference. The hotel does offer room service but you have to spend a minimum of 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: nuttynora
Reviews.Content: Having made the reservation in October last year and made a few requests, as it was going to be my partner's birthday unfortunately I think they lost the emails. It is a lovely hotel but has a few positives and negatives. The first room the toilet did not work and the smoke alarm had been removed! is this legal, they were aware of it but still sent us to the room and after waiting 40 mins for a plumber I requested another room as we were not prepared to wait all evening in our room, we managed to obtain another room again this was a reburbished room but there were a lot of unfinished work around the bathroom and bedroom I think a little more attention to detail this hotel would be great. We had a superior room which was quite small I was pleased we did not book a standard.The staff were helpful and I must admit the breakfast was fantastic a great selection and everything was always replaced as it emptied. The unfortunate problem at breakfast is the coffee machines they must have broken down about 5/6 times every morning causing quite a problem for the staff and customers. The surrounding areas in the hotel are great and the bar area is very comfortable for a night cap. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but there is still room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andrey_Buzin
Reviews.Content: Impressions are quite contradictory. Something was very good, something - not. Great location, no doubt. Good WiFi internet connection. A very good breakfast choice. Really "thin" walls, I could easily here a "bell" of arriving elevator even though the distance was 10 meters. My friend in another room left his room with full set of towels, and when came back in the evening, 2 bath towels were missed. Wonderful bathroom equipment, toilteries are changed daily, however little you used them. Amazingly, sometimes they remove something and don't replentish the stock. And the "standard" rooms are really small - no more than 10-12 sq.m. It was OK for me as I lived alone, but for a couple it would be a bit tense.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: karunkrish
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel, a great breakfast and good service made it easier to deal with the nuisance of really "thin" walls - we could hear our next door neighbors shower and singing in the bathroom.Positives include wi-fi, metro station right outside the hotel, and being walking distance to shopping, sight seeing and restaurants. Breakfast, if included was excellent. The negatives, no parking at all - public parking was extremely expensive like many big cities in Europe - don't take a car if you plan to stay at this hotel. You don't need it !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: m_mayhs
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Clean and modern. Shower was amazing and a really cool internal garden. Right next to Metro station which helps. Free Wi-Fi in hotel is an added bonus. Would certainly recommend this to family and friends. Really cool and trendy bar in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Fran W
Reviews.Content: Santo Domingo covers all the aspects of a superb hotel with great style and comfort. The location is ideal, a couple of streets from the theatre area and on a square with great eateries. our room in the refurbished block had a fabulous colour scheme, delightful comfortable (& electronically adjustable!) beds with gorgeous crisp white linen sheets. the highlight had to be the bathroom - perspex floor, lit to show off the sand, stones and shells beneath, unbelievable design! Beautiful shower and delightful fish wallpaper too. Plus, my partner loved the soft closing toilet lid so much we're having one at home! Breakfast was a stunning array, we particularly liked the cava accompaniment. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I had emailed in advance to ask if they could keep my therapy ice pack in a freezer, they duly agreed and retrieving this from staff twice a day went without a hitch. I accept our experience deals with the newer block of the hotel, but our stay cannot be faulted. Well done Santo Domingo & we look forward to seeing you again sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “So new, and yet in poor condition”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTom78
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that was quite new I was really quite shocked at how poor a condition parts of my room were. The vanity top around the sink was cracked and held together using heavy duty tape and beneath it what looked like a power socket had been covered over by duct tape! Having said that, the room itself was comfortable (though it would have been more comfortable if they had had the double I booked available rather than a twin) The staff were all increadibly helpful, but everything appeared to be a little chaotic with printers not working to get invoices and computers going slow. On the plus side, it is very well located, with a metro station right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “too small rooms, too noisy”
Reviews.Author: dj_Duff
Reviews.Content: + Very close to metro and Puerto del Sol, comfortable bed, good bathroom clean rooms - My suite was so small, that there is no place to put luggage. It's very noisy: you can hear every movement in next suites. Not very nice reception.

Reviews.Title: “The best choose”
Reviews.Author: Evie B
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best one that we could choose. It's in the city centre, and in the middle of shopping and leisure areas (theater, monuments, cinemas...) The rooms are really nice, with a lot of details... The breakfast unbeatable....It has everything you can imagine!!! The hotel staff was really nice and always ready for helping us. There is a subway just in front of the Hotel!!! The Hotel has even a swimming pool, unfortunatelly it was closed and the pool wil be opened in summer. Surely we´ll visit Madrid again in July.

Reviews.Title: “Good Mercure, well located, good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Mercure is located centrally just at the metro San Domingo exit so easy access from and to airport. The hotel has been recently refurbished and it is good looking. I was in a room at the 6th floor where there is a small balcony from where you have some view on the city : having a drink on night there is wonderful. Classical laundry service, cloakroom for luggages when awaiting for getting back to the airport. For the concierge, I asked twice for places to have dinner and the two indications where perfect in terms of relevance to my requirements. I also used the business meeting room at the first floor, very convenient for a group of 12 people. The hotel has a bar underground with a nice design (cave) worth a tour. Overall very good price-quality ratio, particularly if you can book a discounted plan in advance. Services and staff are professional, I would come back either for leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: mquinze
Reviews.Content: I have reserved two rooms conjugated but when I got there, there were none available. End up having to stay in a older room with an extra bed and both my kids slept together on it.Then I was waiting for my luggage to come from the airport and despite the fact I have told the front desk, nobody could find it. Finally, I have asked for a late check out which was given to me but when I arrived to take a bath before leaving, my room was being clean up for another guest.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Melita_Chief1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between 21st and 28th Sep 2011. We have everything good to say about the Santo Domingo hotel. The best features were 1. Its position is only 2 minutes walk away from the SOL, a dynamic and architecturally rich plaza where things happen all the time, from street performers, Latin musicians, bars and restaurants overflowing with delicious foods and wines, good quality shops, the best Gelato in town! My wife fell in love with the whole scenery, and so did I. 2. One practically crosses the road to the Metro, a very efficient underground train system, like Paris, London and New York. 3.The hotel staff all spoke good English and were among the most helpful in our trip: we were in London, Paris and Bercelona this time around; and what warm smiles we used to get, every time!. 4.The breakfast each morning was so lavish that it was more of a banquet than a 4-star hotel breakfast: all kinds of food, fruits, drinks, meats, breads, even wine and champagne...we were treated like royalty at such modest prices that we paid. 5.The service was excellent: when we complained about the erratic internet connections and some noise due to refurbishments that were being carried out, the hotel management, under instructions from the sub-director, Richard Battaler, compensated us exactly as we had asked, no excuses, but lots of apologies; what a gentleman! What a hotel! My wife and I decided to visit Madrid again in 2013; we will return to the Santo Domingo with pleasure and a sure conviction of their high quality service all the way. Alfred and Lisa Melbourne, AUSTRALIA ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Night in a Mercure Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at Mercure Hotels and they have always been good. This nights stay was however to change the good run.The Room temperature was in the Mid twenties and could not be adjusted down. the Staff seemed not to care so much and just said it was still considered winter time and that the coolers were not functioning. Afetr I had paid my bill I made a complaint, which has never been acted on. I am very disappointed not to have had any contact regarding the complaint. The Noise level in the room was unbelievable. Any time that the water in the rooms above or beside mine was run, It sounded like their was a river flowing through the room. The final bad note was that the TV in the room next door was audible even though it didn't seem to be blaring loud. If my Spanish was any good, I could have understood every word of the TV programmes. On the good side the location was great and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: boricuajetsetter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Santo Domingo for work as we had a meeting which took place at the hotel. The room was comfortable although the wi-fi did not work and when I asked the reception they stated they were having problems with the routers. In the meeting rooms it worked perfectly though. The room was also very warm and I did not find the temperature control. Pros: the breakfast buffet was excellent. The front desk staff is very polite and the hotel is in a very central location with 3 metro stops at very close proximity and shopping and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable 4 star with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Biscas
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel and each stay has been "different". During my first stay, I had a room in the older part of the hotel and even though I did not rate that stay I would certainly give it a classification of "terrible"! I do not know if that part of the hotel has already been renovated but I hope they have completed it. If it is still underway, then ALWAYS pay the extra 10/15€ and upgrade into the newer part of this hotel. My second stay I obviously stayed in the newer part and I must say that it was a great stay!! Comfortable and elegant are the correct words to describe this renovated alley of the hotel. Last week I had my third stay and, again, I stayed in the newer part of the hotel. It continues to be comfortable and elegant but I must say that you can easily start to notice the wear. This is nothing serious and is just part of the ageing process but at this fast rate, if hotel management does nothing about it then by next year, thing will be falling apart! Example: the shower is stylish but the shower mechanism is probably not suited for hotel use since it was snapping off place; hallways do reveal how some hotel guests are careless in carrying their luggage. There is also public parking adjacent to the hotel but do remember that any central Madrid parking is quite expensive! On the positive side I would have to say that the location (5m walk from Puerta del Sol) is one of its strong point. Do however take some care if walking around the hotel late at night. Breakfast is also a nice experience with good quality. Out of five points I am going to rate this as 3 but could just as easily rate this as 4. 3.5 would be the correct score!

Reviews.Title: “Santo Domingo, holy sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spacious and luxurious hotel, high quality rooms and very polite staff. Right on top of Gran Via, Callao and near Puerta del Sol and Zarzuela. 2 minutes away from Santo Domingo station. Parking at the hotel does not come so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, not so perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrs_tkb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night. When we booked this hotel (months beforehand) I asked for a double bed room in the new part of the hotel, on arrival we were advised there were none available but there were two single beds pushed together. Got into the room and 2 single beds with a bedside table keeping them apart. This didn't bother us too much and we decided to leave it. The shower wasn't draining and leaked all over the bathroom floor, upon phoning reception I was advised they weren't going to bother changing our room as we were only there for 1 night and we would get more towels!!! Was not impressed and walking around the bathroom on soaking wet towels is not a experience I enjoyed! On the plus side location of the hotel is great with the Metro right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Madrid Santo Domingo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel, Freinly staff but not very sound proof room near lifts and kept waking me every time they were used so wasn't refreshed next morning. The breakfast buffet was very good and plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. location and value”
Reviews.Author: Wombat R
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable stay for a number of days in this hotel. Breakfast is no less than sumptuous. It is not an expensive hotel and very good value for money. We should come here more often. The location is very central and the metro is right outside the door. The rooms and facilities are more than comfortable and again, excellent value for the price. Don't forget to go to Las Carboneras for the excellent Flamenco - near the Opera Metro. Mercure always seems to be a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Jocaxxx
Reviews.Content: The location of the Mercure Madrid Santo Domingo couldn't be better. The hotel is in the very center of Madrid and there are people on the street nearly all day, all days of the week. Here, you're close to Gran Via, the Royal Palace, the Plaza Mayor, the Sol Plaza, and many other attractions. The Santo Domingo subway station is right in front of the hotel lobby, so it's easy to reach the hotel from the airport. I stayed in the new part of the hotel and I liked it. The room and the bathroom are spacious. The bed is cozy. I liked the led lights inside the wardrobe. The wi-fi is fast and stable. The shower and the amenity kit are great. There's in-room safe. One thing I didn't like is that I was a given a room in the first floor (A111), facing the inside of the building and the glass roof of the conference salon of the hotel. One day there was a party going on in the salon and I could see even what people were eating. The noise coming from the party didn't bother me, as I appreciated very much the DJ sound, but it could definitely drive crazy a guest attempting to sleep. However, it only happened 1 out of the 6 days I spent there, on the other 5 remaining days there was nothing but silence. I tried the breakfast buffet only one day and I found it very expensive (14 euros) and not that good. It lacked fruit options and the scrambled eggs were not tasty. I'm glad I didn't include breakfast in the booking process.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Xmas trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my wife. Hotel is very well situated within walking distance of most of the main attractions,restaurants etc, if you want to go further afield (or get in from the airport!) there is a metro station directly outside. Hotel is currently in two bits, old and new, old is undergoing refurb so corridors look a bit tired, our room had had its makeover and was spotless, comfortable and roomy. Would certainly stay here again. To be very picky it's a shame the cave bar does not sell beer!

Reviews.Title: “St Domingo Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and location, stayed on Saturday 26 Nov. On waking up on Sunday discovered no hot water for shower or bath, a technical issue !!! complained to reception gave me a form to complete, manager emailed me to offer 200 points as compensation. Dispute still ongoing, I also noticed room renovations being undertaken, of course no mention of this when paying for room in full 1 week in advance. Very poor response from management, to a fundamental issue, after all who needs a hot shower when they wake up !!! Will I use Mercure again, no, not based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely, to be suggested. Room, personnel, breakfast (great!!!), location is very central, metro very close. Absolutely, to be suggested. Room, personnel, breakfast (great!!!), location is very central, metro very close.

Reviews.Title: “Cold”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located ok quite central but not the best area in town. Hotel had hot water problem which meant I had to shower with cold water 3 times in a 2 night stay. Got discount 50% for the first night but only after asking. Service is friendly and helpful. Bathroom was not very clean. Beds where good. Nice terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staying two night at this hotel, I was positively surprised with the nice room, excellent breakfast and good working internet (for work). Small negatives were the absence of a bath in the double room, low shower pressure on 5th floor and expensive car parking (€30).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Zaganov
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. In front of Metro "Santo Domingo" Station. 1 minute walking from Gran Via and just a few minutes walking from Puerta del Sol and other city centre atractions. The Hotel is divided in two blocks: "A" block is still old, rooms have inadequate and old furniture and Air conditioning still missing in all rooms. "B" block is more adequate for what you've paid for, they call superior rooms on this block and you've invited to an 15 Eur extra/night to stay in this rooms/block. The furniture is modern and AC is finally included. These rooms meets the standards of the Hotel and the Hotel chain it belongs. These should be classified as standard rooms ant the "A" block rooms as inferior ones. They should pay us 15 eur night if we were interested beign downgraded.. All other things respect everything we would expect from a 4 star hotel. Concluding this is a nice hotel with a fantastic location. The only problem is, in fact, the "A" block rooms that do not meet the expectations.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING ! Check Fire Escapes before going to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: John491
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in Sept. 2011. The hotel was undergoing what I would consider a major renovation at the time. The food and room were okay but the room we stayed in meant it was 2 separate lift rides to reception and a 'rabbit warren' to get there. As a Building Consultant I was concerned about fire egress and checked the nearest fire escape. To my horror the door had been jammed open and there was a large chair plus other rubbish on the landing. To cut a long story short, I complained to management 3 times and they did little if anything about this. The last night we left for the airport at 4.30am; I did a final check, the door on my floor had been closed but took a significant effort to open it, to my horror the chair was still there and the doors on the two levels below were jammed open. A great chimney for fire to spread, can you imagine getting out of this hotel in a stairwell full of smoke!! I would not stay in this hotel again - if you are booked or planning to, my advice is to thoroughly check the fire escapes and make sure you can open the doors easily and get out of this building - it is too late at 3am! John and Polly

Reviews.Title: “Not to standard for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Eddie and Judi P
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a standard room and 2 nights in the much more expensive corner room. Location was central and within walking distance to transport and all the inner city attractions. Rooms where basic and did not have tea and coffee making facilities, The rooms where perfectly clean , beds where very comfortable and staff attitudes mixed from very friendly porters and cleaning staff to average attitudes on the front counter and breakfast staff. The breakfast menu was of great quality and for the price you would expect nothing less. The corner room was disappointing the poor workmanship in construction was very evident, The bathroom is plagued with problems with showers leaking from floors above and I would say from our apartment to the floors below, The electrical wiring was exposed throughout the room and the painting was far from professional with evident poor cutting in and unpainted sections along the curtain runners. Would need lots of improvement to recommend. The lack of Tea and coffee making facilities was very disappointing. In all i would be reluctant to stay here again considering the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Below Mercure standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a standard room, but am not sure to which "standard". The walls were so thin that Ifelt like having the head in the bowl when the neighbour used the toilet. Toilet paper in the bathroom was simply stacked on a chair in the bathroom, no holder. WiFi was awfully slow. Definitely not the Mercure standard I am used to. There are better hotels in Madrid for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Santo Domingo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I choose this Hotel because of location and supposed quality of the Hotel. But I was very disappointed. The hotel still in renovation, the rooms are not compatible with the supposed quality. I change the rooms 3 times, I didn't change for the 4th time because I leave Madrid. Although all the staff was nice food quality reasonable I do not recommend this hotel until some necessary changes are made .

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price not its 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Larson
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Mercure Santo Dimingo in room A102 with my daughters and wife. Yes, one room is probably too small for 4 but in this case, why not recommend to take 2 rather than put us in a disability room that provides extra space in the bathroom but with such a small sink that I could barely put my two hands in it! Also, 2 weddings in the last 2 days, with music and lights until 2am... Not the quietest place to spend your time for a week or week-end. The restaurant offers a buffet

Reviews.Title: “Downtown heart”
Reviews.Author: LarryTheVisitor
Reviews.Content: I really never before have booked in a very downtown hotel in Madrid, cos is a very noisy city, full of drunk people every where and not very safe at night, that is what I always heard about Madrid downtown, so I always booked in areas such as Salamanca, Chamberi or Arguelles, just the richest areas circling downtown, but this time I booked here, and I must say the location is pretty good, the tube is right on the front door from the hotel. The room bus ok, not big but not small, was a first floor and was not noise at all cos the room had double glass, so no problem. The breakfast also was good. I was in a room in the old building but it was rebuilt so it was pretty good but not finished.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-but hotel under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location&price of this hotel determined why we booked into the Santo Domingo.On arrival,it became immediately obvious that the hotel is undergoing a renovation-this information was not passed onto us but was not too important...until the following morning when the drilling down the hall woke us very early.This,on top of being in a room right next to the Lift,ment we were awake from a very early hour.So I recommend for anyone staying at this hotel,ask for a room away from the lift and if you have any problems with walking,definately request a room in the new part of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Improvements possible for a nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: RobertManuel
Reviews.Content: I have been there for few days and the overall review is average. The hotel is well located in the heart of Madrid, at equal distance of Plaza de Espana and Plaza del Sol, near Gran Via and the pedestrian way. Unfortunately, there are areas of the hotel under renovation and during the day is not quite pleasant to hear the drilling machines (since the weather was fine most of the day I was out, except few breaks for rest). The reception staff was OK but a little work and training should be done with the staff covering the service at the rooms (forget to knock at the door, checking the minifridge with the guest in the room, etc). Also as I requested to iron a shirt, the iron table was brought after more than 30 min when I already gave up for self-ironing and asked for laundry service at reception desk (the delivery of the shirt is only next day, no emergency service available). The hotel has two towers and some of the facilities/rooms are under reneovation. The room interior is rather old fashion (something that 1980's) but clean and comfortable. The choice for TV stations is limited, just few in other language than spanish. With improvements related to renovation, TV facilities and staff training would have been a very good location. I hope that in the future the management will think to the mentioned above and will improve the service quality.

Reviews.Title: “Smart guys”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo R
Reviews.Content: If you like being in your room and right next to it people working with hammers and drilling machines during all day come to this hotel. They rennovate their rooms and put guests in the same floor at the same time. No respect at all. Short term thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Glocal36
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor before we booked this hotel, we knew it was in the process of being rennovated and were not expecting anything special, but we did think the benefits of staying somehere in the centre with a nice pool would outweight the issues we had read about.....we were wrong. On arrival there was not even a basic level of customer service, we had to wait until the members of staff on the desk decided we were worth talking to and gave us our room keys and told us where to go. There was no mention of the pool, or restaurant. We found our own way to a room in 'Tower B' which involved (as other people have said) taking the lift to the second floor then crossing over to the un-rennovated part of the building. Our room was right at the far end of tower B so we had to lug our own bags down a long dusty corridor, trying to avoid cabling strung across the way and the disgusting smells wafting out of rooms which were being completely gutted with the doors left open, while work men pushed past us with buckets of concrete. By the time we'd got to the room we had already decided to turn back as paying guests should to have to walk through such a mess to get to their rooms. We went to reception and began to complain, however Im sure the staff had heard this many times before, as they were completely non-apologetic and lacking in any normal kind of response and were waiting for us with their standard answer "the room is non-refundable". As we were only in Madrid for 5 days and had come solely for the purpose of relaxing, we decided not to waste our time arguing and just pay the additional charge for an upgrade to the new part of the building. We were however informed that we could only upgrade for our first 2 nights as the new rooms were fully booked after this. We stayed in a decent room for the first two nights (I would not call it 4 star worthy) before we had to check out on the 3rd day to change rooms, and were moved to a room in tower B not far from the lifts. The room was pretty shabby but we were willing to put up with it until we went to turn on the air con only to find there was no aircon unit - it had been ripped out leaving a dirty hole in the wall! Down to reception we went to complain, only for the member of staff to say he would send a technician. After a few minutes of trying to explain that there was no air con unit at all, I showed him a picture of the hole and loose wires and he finally understood, and seemed to be pretty shocked - just shows neither the staff nor management know whats happening in their hotel! We were moved to a room next to the previous one, with a double bed even despite being told earlier that there were no doubles available and we would have to make do with twins. The new room was satisfactory, and we stayed here one night until we had been for a swim the next day and went back to our room to freshen up only to find there was no water. Reception informed us it would be back on in 15 mins which it was, but it was filthy dirty and orange! Another strong complaint to reception got us our first apology of our stay, along with our final night's stay in a nice 'corner' room and breakfast free of charge. Its a shame, given the location and facilities this hotel could be quite a nice place to stay even with the rennovations happening, however due to the lack of management common sense and customer service this is an appalling place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I can realy recommend this hotel because of very good location in the heart of Madrid. The room was quite good. It was in the new part. The service and breakfast was very good. Only the sleeping quality in the first night was not good because of the wedding taking place in the hotel. But the other nights it was good. So if you need to stay in the centre of the Madrid this is the right choice

Reviews.Title: “Poor Conditions Building B (Old Part) - Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MauMau427
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the old part of the building for three nights. Room condition was poor - funny smell if I turned on the AC overnight, water leakage with the shower cap. Renovation is undergoing for the corridor and some rooms of the floor I stayed. Therefore, some noise and paint smell from 8am onwards. Rooms are close to each other so I cam hear next door when people get in and get out; as well as when the housekeeping is vacuum cleaning the room. WiFi connection was bad and I couldn't get access most of the time. There is one computer with Internet Connection made available for hotel guest. However, the computer was either occupied or has problem with Internet Connection. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Given the poor facility conditions, they did their best to help or escalate problems to technician. Hotel location is good. I may consider recommending this hotel to others after the renovation is done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kezzaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Arrived no sure what to expect. The hotel, once we got our bearings was in an excellent location. Central to everything. We walked everywhere and found that the location was perfect. The room was small but good with a balcony. We had 2 single beds which isn't what we had asked for, but what the heck, it was only for a couple of nights. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom area! Very colourful and artistic modern. I would definately recommend staying here and if and when we return to Madrid, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the heart of Madrid and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was yummy and the pool was a great place to lay and relax. When I first saw our room in the interior part of the hotel I wasn't too impressed, but then I saw the vertical garden on the wall and loved it! Great place and I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, very small room but really excellent location”
Reviews.Author: the-flutterbee
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby - smart, clean and welcoming. Nice Room - very small. Bed comfortable though. TV and mini-bar fine. Bathroom was quite nice with shower and bath. Balcony overlooked some of the city but there were cigarette butts in the drain which had obviously been overlooked during the cleaning of the room - disappointing. Location - really great and central. Walking distance to main sites but not too central that you can't get a good night's sleep! Breakfast - very good. Wide range of options and tasted good. Pool - somewhat disappointing as it's a very small area indeed. You can probably only fit about 10-15 people up here comfortably. No bar. Overall the hotel suited our purpose which was tourism. It was clean, centrally-located with friendly staff and good food. Free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Demand a room in the new part. Otherwise, run away ...”
Reviews.Author: AddAdrTA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one nite in this hotel and booked 2 rooms. The Plus: Very well located in the heart of Madrid. The 1st room was located at the corner of the renovated part and was great: large, well equiped, overlooking the santo domingo place with many large windows. The bathroom was nice too & the shower was funny (the right wall was actually a window directly overlooking the street but with obviously a system preventing people to see inside). The buffet breakfast was expensive but it was worth it: A lot of choice with quality items in a nice room (designed as a sort of wine cellar with soft lights). The Minus: The 2nd room was located in the old part of the hotel which is being renovated (which means noisy from 8 am!). It was very small and old with no windows. Awfull! The parking (beware if you have a full size car as the parking lots are small!) was amazingly expensive: 30 euros per night! In addition I was not able to pay when checking out and had to find cash as credit cards were not accepted. I prepaid my stay several months ahead when I booked my rooms on the Accord website. However when checking out, I was told only the 1st room was paid. Despite a printed copy of the booking form stating I already paid the whole stay, I had to connect on the internet on my bank website to print out the bank statement proving I had been charged already. Very unpleasant for me and unprofesionnal from them. At the end, it is a bit of mixed feeling (hence the average rating): We would have only had the 1st room - and despite the error related to the payment - I would have kept an excellent souvenir of this stay. We would have only had the 2nd room, I would have hated that stay ... I then recommend - with no worries - this hotel only if you can manage to get a room in the new part.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the Mercure Brand!”
Reviews.Author: availableascreenname
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently renovated and I was extremely impressed with the Superior Room. It has many features not expected for a Mercure such as mechanically Operated king single beds for changing positions, a rain head shower with other numerous outlets, a glass floor in the bathroom over sand having a beach theme along with a fantastic pool and sun tanning roof deck. All the public areas are completing their renovations and the basement bar is fantastic with a glass floor with led lights beneath it which change colours. The bar also makes the best mojitos which we found out on our last night as this isn't promoted to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive rooms and roof top pool.”
Reviews.Author: Joseyjo78
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying here and especially after reading the bad reviews. I honestly have no idea why they are complaining, the rooms are ultra modern with funky lights and detailed beach bathroom with a sand floor covered with perspex, amazing. The location is unbeatable with the metro right out front. LOVED lazing by the roof top pool and the views of Madrid are amazing. After staying in 5 star hotels in Dubai and London recently, I can honestly say this hotel meets my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Revised Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My last review about Mercure Santo Domingo was very negative, because of several problems found there. My new review totally revise the concept - since the General Management took action to answer me back fast as 48hours after report of the incident. Beside the compensation, not requested by offered by them - the line of action of General Manager in order to quickly fix the reported problem, changed my opinion about the Hotel. This is aligned with the best tradition of Spanish Tourism Industry and reputation of the Accor Group. I will surely suggest - Location is very good, transportation option excellent not mentioning Department Store El Corte Ingles about 5 minutes walk, Gran Via 2 minutes walk and all sort of eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Their Big Fat Spanish Wedding... right above our room!”
Reviews.Author: jaimie_es
Reviews.Content: I do not have a problem with hotels trying to expand their business with on-site night clubs or late bars, as long as these do not interfere with the main purpose of the hotel, which I understand should be to offer accommodation, i.e. a good night sleep. This was not the case during our one night stay at the Santo Domingo in mid July. A wedding reception was allegedly taking place in some sort of function room on the sixth floor, right above our room on the fifth floor. The party was still going strong at 2 am! The noise was so unbearable we had to move to another room two floors down. We will not be returning to the Santo Domingo on our next visit to Madrid later this year... No way!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth theprice”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDaisy08
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, we booked a twin room,myself and adult son, two beds but so close together it seemed like a double bed. Breakfast is quite good but expensive, cheaper cafe across the road. Staff were pleasant and helpful. BUT, if you are planning to lie by the pool and relax, either get there first thing and stay all day or don't bother. I had imagined coming back to the hotel after been out and about in the sun and having a refreshing swim- DIDN'T HAPPEN. Only 7 sun loungers round the pool, there are more another few stairs up on the roof.Pool is very small and doesn't open till 11 am and shuts at 9 pm. Gets very very crowded. Location is good for the metro. For the price I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Expecience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I ever stayed. Absolutely no respect with guest rights.They did rent a room or rooms in the upper level - playing loud musinc and people jumping like crazy during whole night. Even with desperate request to stop it, only answer - cannot do anything. Constant drop in the internet connection, including VPN - management replying - only you are having problem. When asked if can keep lugged during absence -about 08 days - Answer - No, Problem. Tricky part: They say will charge you EUR 6,00 every day(USD10), in the last minute.This hotel really disrespect the Accor Group basic standars. Other notes: Air ventilation bad smelling form the flushing system to air conditioning. Unfair standard for room quality, even old part. Room quality has no standard between them. I'm Star Alliance HON Circle member(600.000 miles+) then I know about what I'm talking. Same Price Leve - Frankfurt Kaiserhof offer unbelievely better quality and service(even with paid internet - fractionable.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!! Simply wow and mind-blowing”
Reviews.Author: YogeshGoel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 31st July - 2nd August 2011 and it simply is a mind-blowing experience. Luckily we got to try 2 different rooms before being satisfied on the third and to our amazement every room is different from the other. Very modern look and interiors and very well thought. It was simply refreshing to see that every room is different. Before this we have gone to around 6-7 hotels of the same standard and never found such a wonderful decor. It also has a wonderful swimming pool located on the terrace. What else do you need. It is centrally located. Almost in the center of the city. The nearest metro is Santo Domingo just infront of the hotel. Even indian restaurants are not far away. Mc Donald and KFC is also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyJane
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. There was some building work going on but it did not interfere with the guests comfort. Right in the centre of the sight seeing and shopping part of Madrid. The breakfast was a very busy time and we had to wait to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but smelly!”
Reviews.Author: juniata3232
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Mercure Santo Domingo, I was very impressed my the lobby. They had kind staff and a beautiful building at a great location. I was initially told that the elevators in the main lobby would not take me to my room, I was to use the evevators around the corner, I thought "oh, no big deal" but quickly realized upon leaving the elevator that my room was in the not-as-nice part of the hotel. I must say that my room and bathroom was very clean. there were plenty of clean towels and bedding. My only complaint was the horrible odor in our room. I visited other rooms of people in my group, and none smelled as ours did. The room had a strong odor of sewage. It wasnt so bad after being in the room a while, but after coming back from the city or upon getting out of the shower, the odor hit you like a wall.

Reviews.Title: “Two faces Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KifeH
Reviews.Content: who comes and looks at the facade and lobby of the hotel, is impressed, however after check-in we were taken to a completely different part of the hotel, much older, classic, modern atmosphere very different from the input. Yet it was still a pleasant stay, providing an excellent base to see Madrid as it is located in the center of town. more after a long day of walking were able to relax in the pool at the top of the hotel, which at first sight seems small, but it is quite enough to cool off and take a good sunbath. rooms, this part of the hotel is rather small, but for me it was more than good, since only a few hours resting in them. better yet the subway entrance is on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Santo Domingo Madrid Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last week and overall was quite impressed. GREAT LOCATION!! However this is 2 hotels combined - we stayed in the older part and unfortunately they are rennovating this part of hotel - so the drilling, banging and SUPER LOUD Construction noise started at 7.30am EVERY morning!! No sleep in!! :( Overall tho - good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The location, pool and new part was great but our room in the old part was far from great”
Reviews.Author: Spainlover82
Reviews.Content: Our room was a disaster. First of all there was a lot of noise. We heard all kind of things at night and didn't sleep well. After the first night with no sleep we complained and the people from the hotel promised they would help us, but never did. We could hear everything the neighbours said and from 8 in the morning till 8 in the evening people worked in the other rooms for renovations, so we could never have a rest. The bed was too small and there was only 1 pillow. We were happy to take our rest at the pool. The pool was really very good!!! So was the location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PeterXaghraGozoMalta
Reviews.Content: Centrally placed near Gran Via ,Opera, Puerta del Sol,Palacio Real & the local Metro station across the street.Best underground rail network I have ever come across & linked to the Airport & mainline station at Atocha. Newer part of the hotel has clean,modern rooms We had a very comfortable king sized bed.Reception staff very helpful & the high spot of the stay was the roof top pool - perfect for a late afternoon swim to cool down after visiting local attractions like the 3 major art galleries.You could still be sunbathing in warm sun until 9.00pm & there are great views over the City.Did not use the Restaurant but it looked good Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Santo Domingo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I will definetely stay again in this hotel . The location is great ..just a few steps from the Gran Via , The room was modern, clean and the showers facilities were extremely good Good Breakfast as well . We also used the pool on the roof with great view of Madrid I have stayed many times in Madrid and this was possibly the best !

Reviews.Title: “OLD vs. NEW part of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When booking, pay special attention whether your room is in the "OLD" or "NEW" part of the hotel. They are completely different (though joined) buildings and almost like two different hotels. Otherwise, excellent location, pleasant pool, extremely close to Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure you are in the newest part of the hotel, otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: alli565
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel through our travel agent for three nights in a superior room. My daughter's friend and her mom were in a standard room. They were in "the back" of the hotel in the older, non-renovated area. The halls were being renovated so it was somewhat messy and under construction. There room had very old/outdated furnishing and fixtures. The "mini bar" was a small refrigerater that just plugged into the wall with the tv overhead (no console or cabinet to hide wires). They had a bidet. I would have been depressed to have been staying in this room. The carpeting was spotted and old. We showed them our room but since we had a superior and they were paying for standard, I guess that is why they were given the room they were given. The entire hotel will be much nicer when it is all up to par as a whole. As far as my stay and room there, the bed was comfortable, we had enough storage in the closet (considering this is European hotel!), and it was clean and new. The pool was just what we needed at the end of the day for our siestas, but it is small. Not too many lounge chairs so get there early if you want to enjoy a lot of pool time. Don't order food or drink because it is so expensive (the lifeguard gets it for you). The water was cold, but refreshing on hot days. The breakfast was included for us, and it was very fulfilling. The restaurant is very nice. Meats, different breads and cereals, yogurts, fruits (cut up as well as whole), croissants that were of variety, cheeses, pastries and churros and great selection of juices or water and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. Very pleased with the offerings there. The hotel is in an excellent location. We shopped at the vendors outside. We ate breakfast and then had drinks at the cafe across the street. It is an easy walk to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. It is right across the street from the metro. We walked to the Prado Museum but then took metro back. Many shops and cafes nearby. I would definitely stay here again for the location AND as long as I am in one of the refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price, and well located”
Reviews.Author: JM4522
Reviews.Content: Just stayed with my wife a couple of days while in Madrid. We decided to pay the extra 15 EUR to get to the renovated part of the hotel. Room service was perfect, and the room was clean. We decided to take breakfast at the hotel, and WOW, this was the best "brunch type" breakfast I had in Europe. Usually included breakfast is croissant, or small bread with jam. At Santo Domingo's you had Champagne (Spanish one), Eggs, fruit, meat... well you had for every taste. Room were very quiet, but well, we are in the middle of the actions in Madrid during week end, so if you want to have a calm night, you better of getting the rear room rather than the street view :-) I didn’t take advantage of the pool. The hotel was really crowded, and so was the Pool

Reviews.Title: “A short break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Almost brand new hotel (we stayed in the "new half"), in an ideal location. The staff were very friendly and the roof top pool is not to be missed at the end of a long hot day. Didn't have breakfast which proved to be a mistake because the local restaurants, although plentiful tuned out to be more expensive. Would definitely use again if visiting Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Agent226
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near many other hotels just off of the main street 'Gran Via'. Across from the main entrance during the warmer months is a local vendor market with great souvenirs. The Gran Via has many stores and great for shopping, but if you're looking for something you can't find back home, you may have to venture a bit further. It's about 3 blocks from the Plaza Major. The breakfast buffet is nice, has fresh juice, and great coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice@”
Reviews.Author: satyenthadani
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable to say. You can see that the rooms have been newly renovated. Would recommend to stick to the new wing. The rooms are slightly small, but that is the case with all big city hotel situated in the heart of the city. Breakfast was satisfactory. The service was very good. The staff was very helpful. No complaints whatsoever. The location is great. Walking distance from most of the main points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, older hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTravelers2
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the hotel through our travel agent prior to leaving the US based on limited reviews. It is in a great location - convenient to Gran Via, Plaza Mayor, El Prado, Metro stop, etc. Unfortunately, it is undergoing a pretty extensive renovation with part of the hotel having been completed (and very modern) and the other a "work in progress". We were given a "classic" room which ended up being in the old part. The room would have been fine for 1 person, but it was VERY small for two (only a full-size bed). But it was nicely decorated, had a flat screen TV and was kept clean. There was no room to open 2 suitcases and the window was blocked by scaffolding. (Fortunately, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room.) On a positive note - FREE wifi through the hotel, including the rooms. Amazing breakfast buffet with hot and cold items (meats, cheeses, eggs, fruits, yogurts), breads and beverages. The front desk staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel not wated to use my A club rewards vouchers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi, This hotel looked very attractive on the web. outside nice, nice rooms etc. However after check in, the room was in the back of the hotel, very old room, dirty carpet, strange smell. This is not what I expect from a **** hotel. After complaining, got a new room, more expensive and still old, dirty carpet and smelling. I gave 4 A-club reward vouchers in the beginning of my stay, on the checkout they did not wanted to use them. In a similar situation in Novotel Amsterdam, where I also prepaid with creditcard, I got cash money back. Note that I travel a lot and am usually happy withe the service offered, except for this time. Best regards Guy guy@vanleeuw.net

Reviews.Title: “It is ok......not amazing....”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a work meeting. It seems to be a popular combination of business / conference accommodation and tourist hotel as it is a 4 Star but quite cost effective and reasonable priced. The hotel does not look great, or very much, from the outside, but they have revamped the bedrooms and the public rooms- and so it is much better than the external look. The bedrooms are small, but do have a bit of a "wow" factor. They are modern looking with a mirror wall to make it look bigger, mirrored table, TV with a huge range of channels and very modern bathroom with shower (no bath) that has a very complex shower head and jets that took me a while to work out. The bathroom has wallpaper covered with perspex or some sort of cover, although I did notice they are not as waterproof as they may have hoped! The beds were fine, but not hugely comfortable. There is a large breakfast room with buffet that has a pretty good spread. We also ate in the same restaurant for lunch, and the food was ok but not amazing or that impressive. They have free wireless access and it is fast, a plus! Overall the hotel is fine. I would not rush back but it is good value, good location and modern rooms. I did not have any problems with noise from the road and area, but some of the people I was with did comment on it. The staff is mixed in terms of service, and the reception service was a bit off-hand and not that helpful, but in some other areas the staff were cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and people”
Reviews.Author: Nvizble
Reviews.Content: Right near the Gran Via and close to shopping, Puerta del Sol and Palacio Real. People were super nice, but rooms were old, small, warm and lots of construction going on. Breakfast was so-so and no real bar there but plenty available in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to see the sites.”
Reviews.Author: WelshGas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4 night break in Madrid, and I have to say that the Mecure Santo Domingo turned out to be the perfect hotel for our stay. We opted for a superior room, which was extremely comfortably furnished and suprisingly, having read reveiws of noise late into the night in Madrid, was actually eerily quite. Admittedly the room faced inward, but I don't think it would have been much different if we'd had a room facing the street. There was very little traffic outside, and although there were always people around until well after mid night, it really wasn't as noisey as we had anticipated. This despite being just 2 minutes walk from Gran Via, although we our stay didn't include a Friday or Saturday night. The only small irritation was that the roof top pool doesn't open until June, but I would definately recommend this Hotel. Outside in the square and surrounding streets, there were plenty of reasonably priced restuarants, whilst the main sites were all within easy reach, either walking or by metro. Finally, I have never felt safer on a City break, contrary to some reviews I have read, and we happily used the metro and walked the streets at all times of day and late at night.

Reviews.Title: “5 nights in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, car parking for guest too expensive but convenient. Staff helpful without going out of their way to give you insights like breakfast concessions etc. Normal rooms far too small - a double cannot accoomdate one open case, let alone two.

Reviews.Title: “OUR TOILET LEAKED FOR 2 DAYS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: our stay was blighted by a leaking toilet and two hostile reception employees. Leak was reported in room 107 in the new block and the repair was not done until later the next day. The water was leaking down into the electric light in the floor. A male reception employee tried to tell me it was my fault for not reporting the fault for the correct room when I queried why it was not repaired and his colleague was then very cheeky/rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: chileboy
Reviews.Content: Let me get this out of the way: the hotel is noisy, I wouldn't recommend it for business travelers. The immediate area is not exactly the most attractive neighborhood in Madrid. That said, there's something about this hotel I really liked, and I would happily stay there again. The location is excellent, just steps from a metro station and a very complete El Corte Inglés department store (has a pharmacy and a supermarket). The breakfast buffet is very, very good, with great coffee available from Nespresso machines. Every staff member I dealt with was professional and cordial. There are scores of restaurants near the hotel. I needed an iron, had it moments after I requested it. Ice is available at the bar where they are prepared with ice buckets. There's free wifi, though my laptop had trouble keeping the signal in my room. It worked perfectly in the lobby. Plus, there's a computer in the lobby for guest use. There are lots of TV channels, mainly in Spanish. If you only want channels in English, you'll be limited to news channels. So... the hotel isn't perfect, but I do like it and enjoyed the four nights I stayed there. I'm sure I'll stay there again. If you're in Madrid as a tourist, this hotel makes a great home base.

Reviews.Title: “Despite letter there is still- no reply”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would like to make a complaint about my recent stay at the Mercure Santo Domingo. I had booked 2 rooms at the Mercure Santo Domingo, whilst my colleagues had booked 4 rooms, with breakfast, at the Best Western Santo Domingo.
