The rooms at the Mercure were more expensive and did not include breakfast. We had checked with our travel agent, who advised us that the hotels had now merged to become the Mercure, but part of the hotel, (the Best Western section), was older and had a separate entrance at the rear of the hotel- now a connecting corridor. Out colleagues would be at the old Best Western and we would be in the Mercure part of the hotel. We all checked in. Our colleagues were shown to the rear of the hotel, and the connecting corridor, to the old part of the hotel-the Best Western. Imagine our disappointment, on specifically reserving rooms in the Mercure part of the hotel, to be also sent to the Best Western part. My room had also been used by a smoker. We returned to the desk and explained we had booked Mercure and not Best Western. We were ignored and simply given non smoking rooms in the Best Western section of the hotel. Had I not specifically booked a better Mercure room, rather than the Best Western with Breakfast, I would not have complained, but my booking was for Mercure. My colleagues paid less per night for the same standard room and also received breakfast, whilst I had paid more without breakfast - I am very disappointed. I also asked our agent to check the two hotels and following her investigations, the Best Western was at the rear of the hotel and is the older part and the Mercure at the front with better rooms and facilities. Our expectations were that we had booked the better Mercure part of the Hotel and not Best Western. Obviously, if we had known we would have been allocated Best Western rooms, we would have booked Best Western for the cheaper rate and had breakfast included. I would like you to investigate this matter on our behalf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: bobinthemiddle
Reviews.Content: A group of 14 of us stayed at this hotel for four nights in March. The location was excellent, being just a short walk away from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. The hotel itself was smart and clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The room we had was in the newer part of the hotel and, whilst it was ok, it was rather small. The shower room was a triumph of design over practicality, but once we worked out how the shower operated it was ok, There were no tea/coffee making facilities, which I found strange in a hotel of this class. The room faced the square and had the sun on it all afternoon. Despite ensuring that we left the window open and the curtain drawn across, the room heated up like an oven and was hot and stuffy overnight. The air conditioning was not operational - it may be that they do not consider it necessary in March, but we were fortunate with the weather and the outside temperature hit 26 degrees C at one point. The buffet breakfast was good and there was a good selection, but the 'hot' food was not placed on heated bases, so very often we were confronted with cold, congealed scrambled eggs and lukewarm bacon, etc. On the whole it is a pity that these small niggles spoiled an otherwise good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Marty074
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. We paid €238 for a triple room for one night without breakfast. When we eventually found our room we thought it had no window in it...but it had....it was open into a ventilation shaft around a corner with scaffolding outside in the darkness and the window was open with rubble on the carpet (and in the cot beside it). We were told we couldn`t move. We tried to turn the cooling on but we were told it doesn`t work until Summer......it was 23c outside!! It was impossible to get cold water in the whb or the shower so we gave up using it. Glad we were only there one night. Do yourself a favour and give it a wide berth. Martin - Dublin

Reviews.Title: “The new and old rooms are from different planets”
Reviews.Author: Lyra85
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend the old side of the hotel: the non-smoking floors stank of cigarettes and mold, were very noisy due to the poor quality windows and displayed the most hideous artwork and furniture. The refurbished side, Mercure, was wonderful, definitely worth the upgrade. Comfy beds and pillows, shiny, pretty, modern bathrooms (loved the fun glassfloors). The rooms were spotless and SUCH a long long way from the old ones. The new rooms were definitely a good value for th price! One of the staff members at the desk, the one i had to deal with, was rude and unhelpful (including to the nice older couple before me), the other staffmember was professional and spoke english fluently. This place is hard to review ! In a nutshell: mercure gets a thumbs up, santo domingo thumbs down

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area but ideal for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Manofsaddleworth
Reviews.Content: An ideal position in the centre of Madrid.Very good for visiting the palace ,puerto del sol and the Plaza Mayor which were all within 5 minutes walking distance.The breakfast was very good and the staff at reception were very helpful.The tour bus stop was only 5 minutes walk.Many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to have been refurbished recently and is an excellent location for both business and pleasure in Madrid. Just outside the door is a glorious pedestrian precinct filled with shops, delightful restaurants and bars, and the Palace is just a few minutes walk away. Rooms are fairly small but well appointed and my only real criticism would be the uncomfortable pillows on the bed. Breakfast comprises and excellent buffet in the ultra chic downstairs restaurant and all in all, this hotel offers real value for money in a city that has become too expensive over the past few years.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF BEING TRICKED INTO STAYING IN OLD PART OF THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: trip-chick-munich
Reviews.Content: If you see this hotel on Expedia it shows a really trendy, nice hotel. However if you book the standard class rooms, you end up in the old part of the hotel which is NOTHING like the pictures shown. It has old fashioned, dark rooms with small and uncomfortable looking beds. If there is space available, they allow you to upgrade for 15 EUR per night to the new part. If not... you will not get what you think you have booked. The location is good, but a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price paid, updated rooms, FABULOUS location. Staff was efficient, our bags were delivered within 5 minutes of check in. Be sure to get a room in the newer "Mercure" part (superior rooms), not the older Best Western part of the hotel. Room was a decent size, large bathroom. Shower was great. Room had a balcony overlooking the city. Great location next to the Santo Domingo Metro station. We paid 70 Euro/night, and couldn't have found a better hotel for the price in Madrid. While it wasn't exactly a "4 star" by American standards, the hotel was clean and modern. I would compare the room to a US Sheraton or Crowne Plaza. Windows were sound proof, so the street noise was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, beautiful room, definately coming back”
Reviews.Author: A380fan
Reviews.Content: We booked a £58 rate from Expedia for a superior room, which was much nicer than expected. Brand new, and with some imaginative decorating. Beds were very comfortable. Even with a 3rd bed in the room, there was still space to move. We had a room at the back overlooking the courtyard, so noise was not an issue. The views from the front are definately not worth any extra noise incurred. Slight issue when checking out as staff thought we hadn't paid in advance, but sorted i a few minutes. I advised my sister to stay at this hotel when she is in Marid in May, only to find that rates are more than double what we paid, also for a Saturday night. look out for those special deals! The pool was closed (for the winter?), but looked like it would be very inviting in the summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerLDN
Reviews.Content: We were in the new building as opposed ' building b' and the rooms were very clean and modern. A problem with the first room and we were moved with no questions. Hotel is directly outside the santo domingo metro entrance. I would stay here again on any future visit to Madrid !

Reviews.Title: “Great location for bargain price”
Reviews.Author: marmite_girly
Reviews.Content: We got a special offer so paid €69 for a superior double with breakfast. It was easy to get to from the airport especially having the metro station just outside. You can walk to just about everything from here and because we were in the 'Best Western' block we did not experience road noise. Incidentally, when we booked it was Best Western but now seems to have been taken over by Mercure. When we first checked in we had a twin room. I called reception and explained I'd booked a double and a guy was dispatched up to give us our new room keys for a superior double. Much better. Big double bed, jacuzzi bath, robes, balcony (not much of a view but nice to get some air), tv with radio channels and mini bar. Actually mini bar prices weren't bad either - €1.95 for a beer or coke. The breakfast buffet was plentiful with a good choice but sometimes a bit cold. We enjoyed it though. Reception was helpful. We had forgotten the travel adaptor so they lent us one. Also great to have free wifi in the room. I would definitely stay here again. I did not see the standard rooms but we were very happy with ours.

Reviews.Title: “Do you feel lucky traveler?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our reservation done via accorhotels.com reading the info appearing at the hotel's web site. It was prepaid for all amount (no cancelation). Santo Domingo Hotel at Madrid consists of two consolidated buildings sharing the same reception. The new building seems to be a Mercure and it is like the photos in the web page. Although the old building is clean with a nice carpet and interior colors hides some very BAD rooms. Our room had the bed located just 1 meter from the door with both bed-tables on the left side because right wall was just 30cm away from the bed! The small window was useless as you can see the small internal free-air area, the roof-top of the previous floor is just 40cm below edge of the window and it is 'equipped' with enough pigeon droppings. Noises from laundry at night (22:30), noises from building reconstructions at the morning (08:00). Your breakfast is almost ready from 07.00 on Sundays but water, bread and crοissants are there after 07:40! An extra (wrong & invalid) charge to my credit card finalize our experience!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, but it was very noisy. My room was facing to the street and the noise insulation of the window did not help.

Reviews.Title: “Santo Domingo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very near metro stops and sight. Restaurants and shops nearby as well. Great breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Colourful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willetton_traveller
Reviews.Content: Well located for walking to all the major sites and shops. Colourful individual decor for each room. Loved the room with electric adjusting beds. Quality restaurant. Helpful staff. Watch out for the slow draining showers.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Hotel near the Center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, excelent accomodation, calm, few noises, great room with plenty of space and a nice double bed, nice breakfest, great price (booked with 1 month prior to the date), right next to the Subway exit, 1 min walk from the main center streets. Poor bath quality (problems with the shower).
